'''Racing Bulls''' is an Italian [[Formula One]] racing team and [[List of Formula One constructors|constructor]] that began in 2024. It is one of two Formula One constructors owned by Austrian conglomerate [[Red Bull GmbH]], the other being [[Red Bull Racing]]. The constructor was rebranded for the [[2024 Formula One World Championship]] from "[[Scuderia AlphaTauri]]" to "Racing Bulls" as part of a management and corporate identity restructure.

==Origins==
{{See also| Minardi|Scuderia Toro Rosso|Scuderia AlphaTauri}}
The team's involvement in Formula One started in the [[1985 Formula One World Championship|1985 season]] when they first competed as [[Minardi]]. The team has been owned by [[Red Bull GmbH]] since the [[2006 Formula One World Championship|2006 season]], when they became Scuderia Toro Rosso. It was announced on 1 December 2019 that the team had selected "AlphaTauri" as a new moniker to promote parent company Red Bull's  [[AlphaTauri (fashion brand)|fashion label of the same name]]. Thus, they became Scuderia AlphaTauri and retired the Scuderia Toro Rosso moniker after fourteen years.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.speedcafe.com/2019/09/29/toro-rosso-to-be-renamed-alphatauri-for-2020/|title=Toro Rosso to be renamed AlphaTauri for 2020|first=Mat|last=Coch|work=[[speedcafe]].com|date=29 September 2019|access-date=29 September 2019}}</ref> They again transitioned to a new name, "Racing Bulls", for the 2024 season.{{citation needed|date=December 2024}}
